message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This analysis uses two datasets, the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the Global Financial Inclusion survey.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Global Financial Inclusion survey"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We employed data on precipitation, temperature and wind speed from the Climate Research Unit (CRU) at the University of East Anglia to investigate the impact of climate change on agricultural productivity in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Climate Research Unit (CRU)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food","Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This article uses a unique dataset generated by collecting information on country-specific human capital stocks and the contribution of migration to these stocks for a selected group of countries across time.", "dataset": ["unique dataset"], "topic": ["Migration"]}, {"sentence": "We use panel micro-datasets of firms in low-income countries extracted from the Enterprise Surveys conducted in the period 2002-2017.", "dataset": ["panel micro-datasets of firms"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "The primary analysis is based on two newly available datasets with high spatial and temporal resolution: the annual high-resolution emissions gridded data and hourly observational data in Beijing and surrounding regions.", "dataset": ["annual high-resolution emissions gridded data", "hourly observational data"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on a cross-sectional household survey dataset recently collected in Cambodia, which includes detailed expenditure information, as well as a food-frequency module to quantify diet diversity.", "dataset": ["cross-sectional household survey dataset"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Using a novel firm-level dataset on corruption incidents in Bangladesh, we study the determinants of corrupt practices.", "dataset": ["firm-level dataset on corruption incidents"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We use a unique dataset that covers 28 cities in 18 countries, with detailed information on public-private partnership deals in the water sector.", "dataset": ["unique dataset"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Water"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines patterns of distress experienced over time using measures of subjective wellbeing and complementary objective measures of mental health derived from the Growing Up in New Zealand (GUiNZ) study.", "dataset": ["Growing Up in New Zealand (GUiNZ) study"], "topic": ["Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "To do this, we used data from both China's National Bureau of Statistics and Blue Book reports, which are provincial-level datasets containing enterprise-level information such as investments, employment, etc.", "dataset": ["China's National Bureau of Statistics", "Blue Book reports"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This analysis uses two datasets, the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the Global Financial Inclusion survey.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Global Financial Inclusion survey"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We employed data on precipitation, temperature and wind speed from the Climate Research Unit (CRU) at the University of East Anglia to investigate the impact of climate change on agricultural productivity in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Climate Research Unit (CRU)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food","Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This article uses a unique dataset generated by collecting information on country-specific human capital stocks and the contribution of migration to these stocks for a selected group of countries across time.", "dataset": ["unique dataset"], "topic": ["Migration"]}, {"sentence": "We use panel micro-datasets of firms in low-income countries extracted from the in Cambodia, which includes detailed expenditure information, as well as a food-frequency module to quantify diet diversity.", "dataset": ["cross-sectional household survey dataset"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Using a novel firm-level dataset on corruption incidents in Bangladesh, we study the determinants of corrupt practices.", "dataset": ["firm-level dataset on corruption incidents"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We use a unique dataset that covers 28 cities in 18 countries, with detailed information on public-private partnership deals in the water sector.", and complementary objective measures of mental health derived from the Growing Up in New Zealand (GUiNZ) study.", "dataset": ["Growing Up in New Zealand (GUiNZ) study"], "topic": ["Social enterprise-level information such as investments, employment, etc.", "dataset": ["China's National Bureau of Statistics", "Blue Book reports"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}]
